  <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="https://covenanteyes.com/cdn/global/css/website.css">

			!function(a,b,c){function d(a){var b,c,d,e,f=String.fromCharCode;if(!k||!k.fillText)return!1;switch(k.clearRect(0,0,j.width,j.height),k.textBaseline="top",k.font="600 32px Arial",a){case"flag":return k.fillText(f(55356,56826,55356,56819),0,0),!(j.toDataURL().length<3e3)&&(k.clearRect(0,0,j.width,j.height),k.fillText(f(55356,57331,65039,8205,55356,57096),0,0),b=j.toDataURL(),k.clearRect(0,0,j.width,j.height),k.fillText(f(55356,57331,55356,57096),0,0),c=j.toDataURL(),b!==c);case"emoji4":return k.fillText(f(55357,56425,55356,57341,8205,55357,56507),0,0),d=j.toDataURL(),k.clearRect(0,0,j.width,j.height),k.fillText(f(55357,56425,55356,57341,55357,56507),0,0),e=j.toDataURL(),d!==e}return!1}function e(a){var c=b.createElement("script");c.src=a,c.defer=c.type="text/javascript",b.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(c)}var f,g,h,i,j=b.createElement("canvas"),k=j.getContext&&j.getContext("2d");for(i=Array("flag","emoji4"),c.supports={everything:!0,everythingExceptFlag:!0},h=0;h<i.length;h++)c.supports[i[h]]=d(i[h]),c.supports.everything=c.supports.everything&&c.supports[i[h]],"flag"!==i[h]&&(c.supports.everythingExceptFlag=c.supports.everythingExceptFlag&&c.supports[i[h]]);c.supports.everythingExceptFlag=c.supports.everythingExceptFlag&&!c.supports.flag,c.DOMReady=!1,c.readyCallback=function(){c.DOMReady=!0},c.supports.everything||(g=function(){c.readyCallback()},b.addEventListener?(b.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded",g,!1),a.addEventListener("load",g,!1)):(a.attachEvent("onload",g),b.attachEvent("onreadystatechange",function(){"complete"===b.readyState&&c.readyCallback()})),f=c.source||{},f.concatemoji?e(f.concatemoji):f.wpemoji&&f.twemoji&&(e(f.twemoji),e(f.wpemoji)))}(window,document,window._wpemojiSettings);
		</script>

  <script type="text/javascript">
jQuery(document).ready( function($){
	$( '.responsiveMenuSelect' ).change(function() {
		var loc = $(this).find( 'option:selected' ).val();
		if( loc != '' && loc != '#' ) window.location = loc;
	});
	//$( '.responsiveMenuSelect' ).val('');
});
</script>

      <h1 class="visuallyhidden">Main Navigation</h1> 
      <ul class="title-area"> 
       <!-- Title Area --> 
       <li class="header-logo"> <a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com"> 
         <div class="logo"> 
          <img srcset="https://covenanteyes.com/cdn/global/images/Logo_Desktop-3x.png 1463w,

   <div class="row"> 
    <p class="breadcrumbs"><span xmlns:v="http://rdf.data-vocabulary.org/#"><span typeof="v:Breadcrumb"><a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com/" rel="v:url" property="v:title">Home</a> \ <span rel="v:child" typeof="v:Breadcrumb"><a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com/support-articles/" rel="v:url" property="v:title">Support Articles</a> \ <span rel="v:child" typeof="v:Breadcrumb"><a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com/support-categories/covenant-eyes-basics/" rel="v:url" property="v:title">Covenant Eyes Basics</a> \ <span class="breadcrumb_last">What does Covenant Eyes monitor?</span></span></span></span></span></p> 
   </div>

  </div>
  <!-- .breadcrumbs --> 
  <div class="content-container"> 
   <h1 class="visuallyhidden">Main Content</h1> 
   <div class="row"> 
    <main class="main-blog-content" role="main"> 
     <article id="post-550" class="post-550 support-articles type-support-articles status-publish hentry support-tags-accountability support-tags-filter support-tags-settings support-categories-covenant-eyes-basics"> 
      <header class="entry-header"> 
       <h1 class="entry-title">What does Covenant Eyes monitor?</h1> 
      </header>
      <!-- .entry-header --> 
      <div class="entry-summary"> 
       <span class="excerpt"> <p>Covenant Eyes captures Web Content&nbsp;accessed by protected&nbsp;computers, smartphones, or tablets, and then provides a rating for each one. It also captures the time and date when the URL appeared on your computer screen, as well as anything we know about that Web Content (such as a web page’s title).</p> <p>On Windows and Mac computers, we monitor&nbsp;all of the Web Content accessed by the device. That includes websites visited on a browser like Chrome or Safari, and it also includes browsing done in iTunes or on a desktop program like TweetDeck.</p> <p>On Android™ phones and tablets, we monitor Web Content generated through <a href="/support-articles/how-do-i-set-up-the-android-app/">a growing number of major browsers and social apps</a>. (We also provide a list of other apps that were accessed on the device.)</p> <p>On iPhone®, iPod touch®, and iPad®, we monitor the Web Content generated through our Browser app.</p> <p>Unlike your computer’s browsing history, this activity cannot be erased. All browsing activity is preserved on the Covenant Eyes servers for 30 days.</p> <h2>What Covenant Eyes does not monitor</h2> <p>Covenant Eyes is not a “keylogger,” meaning it does not capture the keystrokes you enter. This means our Service does not record sensitive or private information, such as e-mail messages, instant messages, chat conversations, or any information you enter into text fields, whether as innocuous as a Facebook message or as sensitive as your credit card information.</p> <h2>Common Types of&nbsp;Web Content</h2> <p>In addition to the words on a page, most websites are made up of many other elements. Some of these elements are visible, such as links, images, embedded videos, or ads. Others are hidden, such as CSS files, which controls the size of the text, the colors of headlines, and other layout and formatting details. Each of these elements has a unique URL (Uniform Resource Locator).</p> <p>These URLs are like puzzle pieces. Seen on their own, they may or may not make much sense, but together, they create websites as we see them. A web page on a site like the Huffington Post, for example, may contain more than 100 URLs, each of which represents a photo, a story, a video, a link, or one of those hidden items.</p> <h3>Common visible media elements</h3> <p>Audio, video, and image files all come in a variety of file types. If you see a strange link on an Accountability Report, check for these file types at the end of the URL. If they appear, you can make a reasonable guess that the element was visible on the website.</p> <p>These are some of the most common file types:</p> 
        <ul> 
         <li><strong>Images:</strong>&nbsp;.png, .jpg, .jpeg, .ico, .svg, .bmp, .tiff</li> 
         <li><strong>Video:</strong>&nbsp;.mov, .mpg, .mpeg, .m4v, .wmv</li> 
         <li><strong>Audio:&nbsp;</strong>.mp3, .mp4, .wma, .wav</li> 
        </ul> <p>For example, if you see “national-geographic-grand-prize-photo.jpg” on a Report, it’s probably safe to assume that the URL is an image or award winning photo from National Geographic. The URL “national-geographic-photographer-interview.mp3” is probably an audio interview with an award-winning photographer, and “national-geographic-winner-interview.m4v” is probably a video interview.</p> <p>Another common file type is&nbsp;<strong>.gif</strong>. These are a set of repeating, still images, halfway between pictures and video. Think of them as mini, repeating slideshows or flipbooks. Animated .gifs are especially popular on sites like Buzzfeed and Tumblr.</p> <h3>Common underlying code elements</h3> <p>Covenant Eyes monitors all of the underlying code elements on a page.&nbsp;Here are some of the most common code elements:</p> 
        <ul> 
         <li><strong>HTML (Hypertext Markup Language):</strong> This defines the content of the page. It often includes page text and contains display information like paragraph breaks, titles, and bold or italicized text.</li> 
         <li><strong>Flash:&nbsp;</strong>A multimedia and software platform that is used with media elements like animation, gaming, and videos.</li> 
         <li><strong>CSS (Cascading Style Sheets):</strong> A library of information to describe the formatting of a document written in a markup language such as HTML. It defines things like the default font and space between paragraphs.</li> 
         <li><strong>PHP (Hypertext Preprocesser):&nbsp;</strong>A language describing the look and formatting of a document written in a markup language like HTML.</li> 
         <li><strong>JS (Javascript):&nbsp;</strong>This is a programming language used with HTML and CSS to build text.</li> 
         <li><strong>JSON (JavaScript Object Notification):</strong> A text format based on Javascript that can be read by both people and machines.</li> 
         <li><strong>CDN (Content Delivery Network):&nbsp;</strong>A large system of servers deployed across the Internet to provide content to users.</li> 
         <li><strong>API (Application Programming Interface):</strong> A library that tells software components how to work together. They can also protect information using keys that restrict who gets certain information.</li> 
         <li><strong>Java:</strong> A programming language designed to run in different settings without adjustment.</li> 
        </ul> <p>Some of these elements may be directly visible, such as ads, which may appear as Flash files or Javascript. Others, such as CSS, should never be directly visible to a person, but may appear on the report if some of the letters in the URL spell something inappropriate (such as the letters “SEX” randomly generating in order).</p> <p><img class="size-full wp-image-47510 alignnone" style="border: 1px solid black;" src="https://i1.wp.com/www.covenanteyes.com/lemonade/wp-content/uploads/2010/07/christianity-today-ad-example-marked.png?resize=456%2C192" alt="christianity-today-ad-example-marked" data-recalc-dims="1"></p> <p>For example, this is a URL that appeared on an Accountability Report. You can see that it is a .json file, which means it may be code used to display something, such as an ad. You can also see which CDN the ad network used to display it, and the website and blog post where it was displayed. This example was supporting code for an ad displayed on a <em>Christianity Today</em> article about women and porn addiction.</p> <p>Most of these pieces of Web Content&nbsp;go unnoticed by the user, and only appear in the&nbsp;<a href="/support-articles/what-is-the-difference-between-accountability-reports-and-the-detailed-logs/">Detailed Browsing Log</a>.</p> </span> 
      </div>
      <!-- .entry-summary --> 
      <footer class="entry-meta"> 
       <div class="row"> 
        <div class="large-12 columns"> 
         <p>Didn't find what you were looking for? <a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com/about-covenant-eyes/contact-us/">Contact Us</a></p> 
        </div> 
       </div> 
      </footer> 
     </article>
     <!-- #post-## --> 
    </main>
    <!-- #main --> 
    <aside class="support-widgets"> 
     <div class="widget support-widget cechatwidget-3">
      <h3 class="widget-title support-widget-title">Customer Support</h3> 
      <div class="customer_support"></div> 
     </div>
     <div class="widget support-widget lc_taxonomy-2">
      <div id="lct-widget-support-categories-container" class="list-custom-taxonomy-widget">
       <h3 class="widget-title support-widget-title">Support Categories</h3>
       <ul id="lct-widget-support-categories"> 
        <li class="cat-item cat-item-3300"><a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com/support-categories/having-internet-conversations/">Having Internet Conversations</a> </li> 
        <li class="cat-item cat-item-3297"><a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com/support-categories/set-up-your-account/">Set Up Your Account</a> </li> 
        <li class="cat-item cat-item-3298"><a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com/support-categories/choose-your-partner/">Choose Your Partner</a> </li> 
        <li class="cat-item cat-item-3299"><a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com/support-categories/understanding-reports/">Understanding Reports</a> </li> 
        <li class="cat-item cat-item-3293"><a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com/support-categories/accountability-partners-conversations/" title="How to add or remove Accountability Partners, how to talk to Accountability users about their Reports, and other common questions.">Accountability Partners and Conversations</a> </li> 
        <li class="cat-item cat-item-3290"><a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com/support-categories/filter-settings/" title="Common questions about the Covenant Eyes Filter, such as the role of the Filter Guardian or how to set up the Filter.">Filter Settings</a> </li> 
        <li class="cat-item cat-item-3292"><a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com/support-categories/technical-problems-2/" title="Troubleshooting problems with software, Accountability reports, and other questions and issues.">Technical Problems</a> </li> 
        <li class="cat-item cat-item-3294"><a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com/support-categories/windows-mac-software/" title="Instructions for installing on Windows and Mac computers, and other common software questions.">Windows and Mac Software</a> </li> 
        <li class="cat-item cat-item-34"><a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com/support-categories/account-management/" title="How to add, edit, or remove users, how to switch billing information, and other common account-related questions.">Account Management</a> </li> 
        <li class="cat-item cat-item-3295"><a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com/support-categories/mobile-apps/" title="How to use Covenant Eyes on Android™ and iPhone®, and other common app-related questions.">Mobile Apps</a> </li> 
        <li class="cat-item cat-item-3291"><a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com/support-categories/covenant-eyes-basics/" title="Answers to common questions, like what Covenant Eyes monitors and how many usernames you need.">Covenant Eyes Basics</a> </li> 
        <li class="cat-item cat-item-37"><a href="http://www.covenanteyes.com/support-categories/accountability-reports/" title="How to read Accountability Reports, how to use the Detailed Browsing Logs, and other common questions related to Covenant Eyes Internet Accountability Reports.">Accountability Reports</a> </li> 
       </ul>
      </div>
     </div>
    </aside> 
   </div>
   <!-- .row --> 
  </div>
  <!-- .content-container -->

        <section> 
         <h3>Subscribe to Pure Minds Online</h3> 
         <p> Enter your email address to get tips, trends, statistics, and support to keep your family safe and your integrity intact online. </p> 
         <div class="gf_browser_chrome gform_wrapper" id="gform_wrapper_19">
          <a id="gf_19" class="gform_anchor"></a>
          <form method="post" enctype="multipart/form-data" target="gform_ajax_frame_19" id="gform_19" action="/support-articles/what-does-covenant-eyes-monitor/#gf_19"> 
           <div class="gform_body">
            <ul id="gform_fields_19" class="gform_fields top_label form_sublabel_below description_above">
             <li id="field_19_3" class="gfield gfield_contains_required field_sublabel_below field_description_above gfield_visibility_visible"><label class="gfield_label" for="input_19_3">E-mail address<span class="gfield_required">*</span></label>
              <div class="ginput_container ginput_container_email"> 
               <input name="input_3" id="input_19_3" type="email" value="" class="medium" tabindex="32" aria-required="true" aria-invalid="false"> 
              </div></li> 
            </ul>
           </div> 
           <div class="gform_footer top_label"> 
            <input type="submit" id="gform_submit_button_19" class="gform_button button" value="Subscribe" tabindex="33" onclick="if(window[&quot;gf_submitting_19&quot;]){return false;}  if( !jQuery(&quot;#gform_19&quot;)[0].checkValidity || jQuery(&quot;#gform_19&quot;)[0].checkValidity()){window[&quot;gf_submitting_19&quot;]=true;}  " onkeypress="if( event.keyCode == 13 ){ if(window[&quot;gf_submitting_19&quot;]){return false;} if( !jQuery(&quot;#gform_19&quot;)[0].checkValidity || jQuery(&quot;#gform_19&quot;)[0].checkValidity()){window[&quot;gf_submitting_19&quot;]=true;}  jQuery(&quot;#gform_19&quot;).trigger(&quot;submit&quot;,[true]); }"> 
            <input type="hidden" name="gform_ajax" value="form_id=19&amp;title=&amp;description=&amp;tabindex=32">

         <iframe style="display:none;width:0px;height:0px;" src="about:blank" name="gform_ajax_frame_19" id="gform_ajax_frame_19" title="Ajax Frame">This iframe contains the logic required to handle AJAX powered Gravity Forms.</iframe> 
         <script type="text/javascript">jQuery(document).ready(function($){gformInitSpinner( 19, 'http://www.covenanteyes.com/lemonade/wp-content/plugins/gravityforms/images/spinner.gif' );jQuery('#gform_ajax_frame_19').load( function(){var contents = jQuery(this).contents().find('*').html();var is_postback = contents.indexOf('GF_AJAX_POSTBACK') >= 0;if(!is_postback){return;}var form_content = jQuery(this).contents().find('#gform_wrapper_19');var is_confirmation = jQuery(this).contents().find('#gform_confirmation_wrapper_19').length > 0;var is_redirect = contents.indexOf('gformRedirect(){') >= 0;var is_form = form_content.length > 0 && ! is_redirect && ! is_confirmation;if(is_form){jQuery('#gform_wrapper_19').html(form_content.html());if(form_content.hasClass('gform_validation_error')){jQuery('#gform_wrapper_19').addClass('gform_validation_error');} else {jQuery('#gform_wrapper_19').removeClass('gform_validation_error');}setTimeout( function() { /* delay the scroll by 50 milliseconds to fix a bug in chrome */ jQuery(document).scrollTop(jQuery('#gform_wrapper_19').offset().top); }, 50 );if(window['gformInitDatepicker']) {gformInitDatepicker();}if(window['gformInitPriceFields']) {gformInitPriceFields();}var current_page = jQuery('#gform_source_page_number_19').val();gformInitSpinner( 19, 'http://www.covenanteyes.com/lemonade/wp-content/plugins/gravityforms/images/spinner.gif' );jQuery(document).trigger('gform_page_loaded', [19, current_page]);window['gf_submitting_19'] = false;}else if(!is_redirect){var confirmation_content = jQuery(this).contents().find('.GF_AJAX_POSTBACK').html();if(!confirmation_content){confirmation_content = contents;}setTimeout(function(){jQuery('#gform_wrapper_19').replaceWith(confirmation_content);jQuery(document).scrollTop(jQuery('#gf_19').offset().top);jQuery(document).trigger('gform_confirmation_loaded', [19]);window['gf_submitting_19'] = false;}, 50);}else{jQuery('#gform_19').append(contents);if(window['gformRedirect']) {gformRedirect();}}jQuery(document).trigger('gform_post_render', [19, current_page]);} );} );</script>
         <script type="text/javascript"> if(typeof gf_global == 'undefined') var gf_global = {"gf_currency_config":{"name":"U.S. Dollar","symbol_left":"$","symbol_right":"","symbol_padding":"","thousand_separator":",","decimal_separator":".","decimals":2},"base_url":"http:\/\/www.covenanteyes.com\/lemonade\/wp-content\/plugins\/gravityforms","number_formats":[],"spinnerUrl":"http:\/\/www.covenanteyes.com\/lemonade\/wp-content\/plugins\/gravityforms\/images\/spinner.gif"};jQuery(document).bind('gform_post_render', function(event, formId, currentPage){if(formId == 19) { 
        (function($) {
                $(".ginput_container").has("input[type='email'],input[type='text'],input[type='password'],select,textarea").find("label").each(function() {
                        var e = $(this), fielddesc = $("<div>").append(e.clone()).remove().html();
                        e.siblings("input,select,textarea").before(fielddesc);
                        e.remove();
                });
        })(jQuery);
 
        } } );jQuery(document).bind('gform_post_conditional_logic', function(event, formId, fields, isInit){} );</script>
